result.execSummary:
The defendant Antoine Lee Baskin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: With credit for 7 DAYS served.  A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and DNA Surcharge be paid due no later than 10-7-2024.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Antoine Lee Baskin

records.addlTxt:
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  

AS TO COUNT 1: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 7 DAYS in the House of Correction; with credit for 7 DAYS served.  A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION

The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and DNA Surcharge be paid due no later than 10-7-2024.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

The defendant is advised of his/her appeal rights by defense counsel.

Defendant Antoine Lee Baskin in court.  Attorney Christopher John Ertl in court for Antoine Lee Baskin.  Attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: STW 
Case set for Plea and Sentencing.  Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Plea hearing proceeded.

AS TO COUNT 1:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Elements/Jury Instructions, received and filed.  Stipulation by the parties to criminal complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea. Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint. Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.

Case proceeded to sentencing hearing.

e-Filed: Plea questionnaire/Waiver of rights; Addendum to plea questionnaire and waiver of rights; Jury Instructions/Elements of the Offense
Pretrial Incarceration Credit received and filed.

Defendant Antoine Lee Baskin in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Calendar Call. DEFENDANT APPEARS. Defense request a plea and sentencing date.  Court ordered case adjourned. 
Parties advised:  Effective  July 30, 2022  this calendar will be assigned to Judge JD Watts, Branch 15  in Room 623 of the Courthouse.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antoine Lee Baskin in court with attorney Christopher John Ertl.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST.Case in court for Pretrial Conference.  
Discussion held off the record. Defense counsel recently appointed and awaiting discovery and offer in this case.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
This hearing will be be held streamed Live through dacast- via Zoom.  Status conference scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on May 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Antoine Lee Baskin in court.  Katherine Seelow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Ashley, Branch 19.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 19 for a Pretrial Conference.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/06/2022@2:00
